channel.title: Data Analysis @ UoE LEL
channel.description: Recent content on Data Analysis @ UoE LEL

item.title: Terms & Conditions
item.description: 1. Definitions We collect certain identifying personal data when you sign up to our Service such as your name, email address, PayPal address (if different from email address), and telephone number.

item.title: Courses
item.description: LEL students can take the following courses that focus on research methods and data analysis.

item.title: Data analysis
item.description: Note! This page provides resources on how to analyse measurements (e.

item.title: Falsifiability
item.description: Definition A statement is falsifiable if it can be contradicted by an observation.

item.title: Measures and metrics
item.description: Acoustics Using Praat for linguistic research is an excellent starting point for learning which measurements and metrics can be used for which purposes and how to obtain them in Praat.

item.title: Quantitative analysis plan
item.description: The information given on this page concerns only students who will carry out quantitative analyses (so it does not apply to students doing qualitative analyses).

item.title: Research Skills
item.description: Research management Best practices Best practices for researchers compiled by the Open Science Foundation.

item.title: Software
item.description: Language data management ELAN: annotation tool for audio and video recordings.

item.title: Study design
item.description: Research questions and hypotheses Mits Ota has created a slide deck on how to plan a study for your research project.

item.title: Support
item.description: There are different support channels for Hons/MSc/PhD students who are writing their dissertation, and researchers/staff who are seeking help with any aspect of quantitative data analysis.

item.title: Variable types
item.description: Continuous variables The variable can take on any positive and negative real number, including 0: Gaussian (aka normal) distribution.
